page.title: 11FLORA
page.content: Where the snow has lain longest in the hedge corners groups of snowdrops appear like magic with the early sunshine. Patches of yellow celandines open their petals to the sun and suddenly it's Spring. Primroses, violets and cowslips follow and as Spring turns to Summer the hedgerows are full of colour - tall hedgeparsley shy wood anemones, dainty lady's smock red campion,stitchwort and dandelions. By May the woods are carpeted with bluebells,filling the air with fragrance. The fields may be weedfree but are still bordered with poppies. Mallow, campanula and spiky mullein brighten wooded corners. The hedges are a mixture of hawthorn, blackthorn, hazel, elder, holly, broom and spindle interwoven with rose, honeysuckle, clematis and wild hops displaying year-round colour.
